sections.title: HOW SOON WILL JESUS COME?
sections.text:
After describing the events that were to characterize the time just preceding b | 1
His second coming, Jesus concludes His remarks by saying, o
“[ tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all =_ |
these things have happened.” —Matthew 24:34. |
The conclusion is obvious—the generation portrayed by these signposts of 3 |
prophecy will see Jesus return to earth a second time. It won't be long until He'll 5015
sweep away sin and suffering, and establish His everlasting kingdom. Jesus '
cautions, “No one knows . . . that day or hour” (verse 36). | |
And Jesus continues:
' “You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour ‘: g
when you do not expect him.” —Matthew 24:44.
o 3. JESUS, THE WORLD’S ONLY HOPE ‘
Christ is the last, best hope for our world because only He can deal with the | '
very thing that is destroying it—sin. Jesus died on Calvary to make possible the 4
defeat of evil and deliverance for all who respond to His offer of salvation. ‘ : 1
“He who does what is sinful is of the devil, because the devil has been 1 :
' sinning from the beginning. The reason the Son of God appeared was to ‘
destroy the devil’s work.” —1 John 3:8. - -


‘m '
{ Our Savior created a way out of our crumbling world by sacrificing His own r
| flesh and blood. And the same Jesus, who will someday cure all the world’s ills by »
. destroying sin, offers right now to erase the guilt of sin from your life. You don't & _;; .
have to wait for the Second Coming to find release from guilt, and from anxiety = & |
| and destructive behavior. Jesus is quite willing to give you His kind of peace this , »
| very moment. i 5
While attending a religious meeting a young woman felt strangely moved by |8
the gospel presentation. As she heard the story of a soon-coming Savior unfold, | e ‘
all the pieces began to fit into place. This made sense. She decided that shed - i
been looking for love, happiness, and peace in all the wrong places. Jesus had to | ﬂ |
be the answer. 1 i
| The next day when the evangelist and his associate went to see her, she | _
poured out the story of a bitter and broken life. She'd sunk to the bottom as an ‘ i
| alcoholic, and was supporting herself through prostitution. After describing her 8 | %L 4 ,
| problems, she sobbed out, “You were really speaking to me last night”” ; ' |
But the voice that had reached her heart was the voice of God. And He was i
speaking tenderly. She decided to lay it all on the line. She invited Christ to
' come into her heart as Savior and Lord, and fastened onto the hope of His soon | | '
return.
In the weeks that followed, she began to notice that her many fears and - |
insecurities, which shed always+tried to drown in drink, now found release asshe & i3 bl
: spent time communicating with Jesus. He began to deliver her from the |
compulsions that had been wrecking her life. | .
) She had done a lot of things she wasn't proud of. But Christ’s grace and i ‘
Be. forgiveness proved stronger than her shame. The experience of the thief on the ‘
cross meant a lot to her. In his last, desperate hours he turned to the Innocent 3
- Sufferer beside him and asked, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your | | \
kingdom” (Luke 23:42).
| Jesus immediately answered by promising the thief a place with Him in |
paradise (verse 43). The same Jesus who graciously offered forgiveness to that i ,
dying thief, now offers you salvation, complete pardon, and peace of mind. %
Discover it for yourself today. i |
You too can pray with the dying thief: “Jesus, remember me when you come | .
into your kingdom?” And Jesus will answer, “I will come again, and you will be |
with Me in paradise.” ,
